title: LocalBuddy: Customer and Vendor portals with map-based vendor discovery

requirements.text: Create a LocalBuddy frontend information architecture with two clear entry points: (1) Customer/User portal and (2) Vendor portal, including a simple landing page that explains the service and routes users into the correct portal.

quotes: create two components one for customer or user and another form vendors the website name is localbuddy website

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page displays the name “LocalBuddy” and has two prominent actions: “I’m a Customer” and “I’m a Vendor”.
Customer and Vendor portals are accessible via routes and via navigation without page reloads.
All user-facing copy is in English.

requirements.text: Implement the Customer/User portal UI to browse nearby vendors on a free street map and via a list view, with interactive vendor detail panels (vendor info, menu items, price range, hours, and directions link).

quotes: it is like street vendor to the customer directly usinh the free street map

acceptanceCriteria: Customer portal shows a map view using free street map tiles (e.g., OpenStreetMap) and a vendor list view.
Selecting a vendor in the list highlights it on the map and opens a detail panel.
Customer portal supports basic search/filter controls (at minimum: text search and category/food type).
Vendor locations render as markers/pins on the map.

requirements.text: Implement the Vendor portal UI that allows a vendor to create and manage their vendor profile and menu (add/edit/remove menu items and set a map location).

quotes: create two components one for customer or user and another form vendors

acceptanceCriteria: Vendor portal provides a form to create/update vendor profile fields (at minimum: name, description, food category, hours, price range).
Vendor portal provides CRUD UI for menu items (at minimum: item name, description, price).
Vendor portal includes a map-based location picker to set/update vendor coordinates.
Changes persist via the Motoko backend and are visible in the Customer portal after refresh.

requirements.text: Add a Motoko backend data model and APIs to store vendor profiles, vendor locations (latitude/longitude), and menu items, and to query vendors for the Customer portal.

quotes: provide the service to the student and new people comes form the new cities

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query method(s) to list vendors and get vendor details (including menu and location).
Backend exposes update method(s) for vendors to create/update their vendor profile and menu.
Backend stores data stably so it remains after canister upgrade (use stable storage patterns as needed).

requirements.text: Wire the frontend to the backend using React Query for data fetching/caching, including loading states, empty states, and basic error handling for all primary screens.

quotes: please create the interface very high level and very interactive level for efficent more looking good

acceptanceCriteria: All vendor list/detail and vendor management screens show a loading indicator during fetch.
Empty states are shown when there are no vendors / no menu items.
Errors from backend calls are surfaced in the UI in a user-friendly way.

requirements.text: Add a coherent, modern visual theme for LocalBuddy (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) that feels friendly and accessible for students and newcomers, and apply it consistently across landing, Customer, and Vendor portals.

quotes: very high level and very interactive level for efficent more looking good

acceptanceCriteria: A single consistent theme is evident across all pages (navigation, buttons, cards, forms, panels).
Theme does not use a blue/purple primary palette by default.
Layouts are responsive for mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Add generated static brand assets and use them in the UI (logo and a hero illustration) by placing them under frontend/public/assets/generated and referencing them directly from the frontend.

quotes: the website name is localbuddy website

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the landing page UI.
Logo is used in the header/landing area without requiring backend image serving.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Do not edit immutable hook/bootstrap files (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts / .tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
nonGoals: External database integration (PostgreSQL/MySQL/MongoDB/Redis) or third-party hosting dependencies.
Real-time tracking or live location sharing (no websockets/real-time chat).
Social login providers other than Internet Identity.

required: LocalBuddy wordmark logo, warm earthy palette, simple readable typography (localbuddy-logo.dim_512x256.png)
Friendly hero illustration of a street-food stall and diverse customers in a simple flat style (localbuddy-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
